title: "PVP.net Patcher Kernal has stopped working" every time
body: Starting today, every time I try to launch LoL it gives me the "PVP.net Patcher Kernal has stopped working" error. I restarted my computer and the problem has not gone away.

replies.body: In the past people suggested running as an admin, which is working for me.

Yup, that sounds like an easy fix! Because the League client interacts with a ton of files outside of the League installation folder, it requires specific permission to be able to do so. This is why assigning proper system permissions to League is so important for it to run properly. 

I'm glad to hear you found a fix, let me know if you have any questions.
But what changed between yesterday and today that I now need to run it as an admin?

Your system's files change all the time, and certain files League relies on could have moved, requiring League to now have administrative permissions to reach those files again. In most cases, it's better to run League as admin all the time, to prevent problems from occurring later down the road.
This is also an issue with me.  Maybe it has issues with the new patch
